item.title: 'This is no life': Security and long-held views shattered in south Lebanon amid Israeli strikes
item.description: A year on from a ceasefire in Lebanon, Israel is continuing attacks on what it says are Hezbollah's efforts to recover from their war.

item.title: Chris Mason: Reeves chooses to tax big and spend big
item.description: In a Budget dogged by months of leaks, Labour hopes its big tax and spend plans pay off.

item.title: The Papers: 'High welfare, high tax' and 'Budget goes as billed'
item.description: Budget highlights, lowlights, and an OBR blunder lead all the front pages in Thursday's papers.

item.title: 'Our Â£3.6m bill for flats too dangerous to live in'
item.description: Two unsafe tower blocks in Kirkby, Merseyside, were closed down by the fire service in July.

item.title: US suspends immigration requests for Afghans after National Guard shooting
item.description: The alleged gunman in the Washington shooting is an Afghan national who entered the US in September 2021.
